Key Match Events: Karl-Anthony Towns led the way with 44 points, 16 rebounds, and five assists as the Knicks fell on the road to the Bulls, losing 139-126.
Zach LaVine and Coby White countered the dynamic duo of Towns and Brunson by combining for 66 points.
Five players from the Bulls scored in double figures, highlighting the Knicks’ lack of depth.
In the first half, Jalen Brunson showcased a dominant performance, scoring 26 points, leading the Knicks to a nine-point advantage at halftime.
Karl-Anthony Towns scored 25 points in the fourth quarter alone.
Chicago outscored the Knicks 41-17 in the third quarter.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks started 2025 on a positive note, defeating the Jazz; however, they now have a record of 1-2 to begin the new calendar year.
After playing three games in four nights, the team’s collection of talent was unable to maintain strong defensive performances.
By the late third quarter against Chicago, the Knicks appeared fatigued.
It was commendable for Karl-Anthony Towns to take charge in the final moments, determined not to lose, but his efforts ultimately fell short.
